projects.title: Workshop Upgrade and 5S implementation
projects.description: - Objectives: Using the natural work team, use Continuous Improvement to set in order the Algeria workshops & to develop a strategy for improvement of the Service Quality of the location in line with the Environmental Solutions segment requirements & develop a roll-out plan for the remaining facilities & offices in the area. - Event Approach and Tools used: 6S, Ishikawa Diagram (Cause-Effect Diagram), Decision Matrices, Brainstorming, Value Stream Analysis, workplace optimisation, spaghetti diagrams, visual process controls, etc Data & Facilities Required for Event •	Asset Register •	ES Inventory register •	Workshop equipment maintenance records & procedures •	Workshop current procedures & QHSE statistics •	Number of employees •	Future plans – equipment & market •	Any service quality related measurements of any form if existing (e.g. No of ES complaints etc.) •	Layout diagram of the work shop & offices •	Projector, screen & access to M-I SWACO network & Printer •	Room for planning & discussions •	Marker Pens •	Spray-paint (to mark scrap objects) •	Plastic Document sleeves (to protect Red Tags) •	Tie wraps •	NOBO board & easel •	Area for red tagged objects •	Paint & brushes •	Shovels & yard brushes •	PPE •	Fork Lift Truck or other suitable lifting machines

projects.title: Inventory Management and Improvement
projects.description: Reduce inventory levels for finished barite to a maximum of 2000 big bags while maintaining 100% customer fulfillment rate. Eliminate any spare parts shortage for 2011 Event Scope: Traditional Manufacturing Value Stream Mapping of Barite Mill. Introduction of Total Productive Maintenance for manufacturing processes and an inventory improvement. Review of forecasting tools & inventory management principles Objectives: •	Value Stream Map the Barite Mill process •	Introduce CI manufacturing tools (SMED, 5S, Standardized Work, Operator Balance, Andon, etc.) based on opportunities identified during mapping • Implementation of Total Productive Maintenance Methodologies to improve Overall Equipment Effectiveness. •	Improved inventory forecasting of the need for ore and improve methods to maintain a precise safety level of finished Barite

profile_positions.description:
- Local quality leader, lead Quality meetings and be a key member of location Quality Steering Committee, 
- Responsible for leading the Quality investigations and effective Remedy Work Plans,
- Leading location Quality self-assessments by creating effective implementation Plans,
- Ensuring compliance with segment's and company's quality standards, processes and procedures, 
- Preparing, updating and raising necessary quality documents and procedures as needed,
- Assisting with the coaching and development of new Quality and CI Lean Project Leaders, 
- A Clear focus on location processes, optimizing initiatives everywhere possible. 
- Implementing and monitoring the Quality Management System under ISO 9001:2008 standard,
- Leading internal and external Quality audits, communicating the results and setting up the Remedy Work Plans,
- Initiating, leading and monitoring Continuous Improvement and Lean projects,
- Leading Kaizen and 5S events and workshops,
- Translation of legal and procedural documents from French into English and vice versa.
profile_positions.title: Quality Coordinator and CI Lean Champion

profile_positions.description:
- Maintaining and improving a common suite of integrated management procedures that are applied as required across the diverse range of business activities. 
- Guiding and assisting business processes and support units to develop standard operating procedures and associated documentation that address business specific needs.
- Establishing business focused guidelines for management review; ensuring that these are applied at divisional level, and consolidating divisional risks, information and activities into a complete and global programme. 
- Providing and maintaining a competent and effective internal audit function through coordination with internal and third party resources. Coordinating the internal (quality audit) programme 
- Alerting divisions to risk of ISO certification non compliance and the reviewing the suitability of preventive and corrective action plans. 
- Independently verifying the completion and effectiveness of preventive and corrective action plans. 
- Coordinating effective arrangements with the external certification body. 
- Verifying the effectiveness of measures introduced to identify and address risks to product and service quality identified through audit and management review.
- Ensuring that lessons learned from internal and external quality audits are captured and addressed for the benefit of the whole organization. 
- Defining on-going management system training and development requirements for user and management staff. 
- Guiding and assisting support and functional units to set realistic, aligned quality objectives.
- Other administrative tasks: translation of legal and procedural documents from French into English and vice versa.
profile_positions.title: Quality Management System Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
- Manage the company’s travel requirements and make reservations on all airline, airport pickups, hotels and conference room reservations for company executives.
- Visa applications for expat personnel in all countries and where executives would require travel, and plan ahead accordingly to prepare any documentation as may become necessary with least entrance requirement preferred. 
- Travel folder preparation, including itineraries, electronic bookings, meeting schedules, agendas, visa applications follow-up, local paperwork (residence cards, passes, work permits), 
- Handle special administrative projects, as well as overflow work from departments and executive assistants (Translation of document), 
- Perform tasks, such as systematically arranging letters of invitation, visa history, memoranda, invoices and other indexed documents according to the company's established system.
